definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Being ignor of the law is not accepted as an excuse for breaking the law.
sentences.chinese: 对法律的无知，不能作为破坏法律的托辞而被接受。

sentences.english: Sometimes weneed to provide ourselves alibis.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我们需要给自己找一些托辞。

sentences.english: Sometimes we need to provide ours elves alibis.
Alternative energy sounds like a cop-out .
sentences.chinese: 替代能源听上去像是托辞。
他的托辞只是缓兵之计。

sentences.english: The alibi was fabricated by him .
sentences.chinese: 这种托辞是他臆造出来的。

sentences.english: Some members of congress are now calling for federal laws against pretexting .
sentences.chinese: 国会的一些成员呼吁制定联邦法律来禁止“托辞”。

sentences.english: The alibi was fabricated by him.

definition: to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
to plead/to claim as an excuse
